wikipedia_page.main: Francis Eckley Oakeley (5 February 1891 – 1 December 1914) was an English rugby player. Having been educated at Hereford Cathedral School, he later played as a scrum-half and won four caps for England between 1913 and 1914.  He was killed during the First World War,  when the submarine he was serving aboard, HMS D2, disappeared.
